shorts.title: PIAA FOOTBALL: Scranton Prep falls to defending champ Northwestern Lehigh
shorts.title_distilled: PIAA FOOTBALL: Scranton Prep falls to defending champ Northwestern Lehigh.
shorts.description: BERWICK — Facing a third-and-11 and trailing by four touchdowns midway through the third quarter, Scranton Prep’s Will McPartland dug deep to keep the drive alive. The senior quarterback rolled right, avoided two pass rushers and reversed field. AJ Croom never gave up on the play, either. McPartland found him, and threw across his body to his sliding senior receiver for an 18-yard gain and a first down. “We’re late in the game and not in the position we should be, and just trying to make a play, trying to do everything we can,” McPartland said. The drive lasted 16 […]
shorts.content: BERWICK — Facing a third-and-11 and trailing by four touchdowns midway through the third quarter, Scranton Prep’s Will McPartland dug deep to keep the drive alive. The senior quarterback rolled right, avoided two pass rushers and reversed field. AJ Croom never gave up on the play, either. McPartland found him, and threw across his body to his sliding senior receiver for an 18-yard gain and a first down. “We’re late in the game and not in the position we should be, and just trying to make a play, trying to do everything we can,” McPartland said. The drive lasted 16 […]
shorts.content_distilled: BERWICK — Facing a third-and-11 and trailing by four touchdowns midway through the third quarter, Scranton Prep’s Will McPartland dug deep to keep the drive alive.

shorts.title: COLLEGE FOOTBALL: Paris has impact during Diplomats’ championship season
shorts.title_distilled: COLLEGE FOOTBALL: Paris has impact during Diplomats’ championship season.
shorts.description: Louis Paris patiently waited to get healthy, then made a powerful impact in his first fall as a collegiate football player. After a torn ACL in the PIAA playoffs ended his senior season at Scranton Prep in 2024, the rugged leader had reconstructive surgery and months of rehabilitation to prepare for summer camp at Franklin & Marshall College. The former Times-Tribune Offensive Player of the Year started his collegiate career by competing for time at quarterback. Then, once cleared for full contact, the coaching staff approached Paris about changing positions to running back. The consummate team player, he agreed and […]
shorts.content: Louis Paris patiently waited to get healthy, then made a powerful impact in his first fall as a collegiate football player. After a torn ACL in the PIAA playoffs ended his senior season at Scranton Prep in 2024, the rugged leader had reconstructive surgery and months of rehabilitation to prepare for summer camp at Franklin & Marshall College. The former Times-Tribune Offensive Player of the Year started his collegiate career by competing for time at quarterback. Then, once cleared for full contact, the coaching staff approached Paris about changing positions to running back. The consummate team player, he agreed and […]

shorts.title: Lackawanna County Court Notes, November 22, 2025
shorts.description: MARRIAGE LICENSES Josue Paramo and Amy Sodeida Nohemi Cuxum, both of Dickson City. Lisa Marion Cummings and David Allen Sherry, both of Clarks Summit. Israel Rodriguez-DeJesus and Estela Bautista, both of Scranton. PROPERTY TRANSACTIONS Michelle and John Druther Jr., Clarks Summit, to Luciano Terrazas Cabrera and Dolores Hernandez Moran, Bronx, N.Y., as tenants by the entirety; a property at 1717 Clay Ave., Dunmore, for $270,000. Harry D. Buck Jr. and Karisa Zahornacky, now by marriage Karisa Buck, Waverly Twp., to Jonathan and Amanda Butler, Fort Meade, Md.; a property at 525 N. Abington Road, Waverly Twp., for $575,000. John R. […]

shorts.title: Clipboard, November 22, 2025
shorts.description: Carbondale Soup sale: Trinity Episcopal Church is holding a homemade soup sale until the end of winter or until soups run out. Quarts, $9; pints, $5. There is also chili and stew available in pints for $6. Those interested can stop by weekdays, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m., at the church, 58 River St. Information: 570-282-3620. Forest City Christmas at the Museum: 2025 Christmas at the Museum, Nov. 29, Main and Dundaff streets. Doors open 11 a.m. Choral and band concert, 1 p.m. Includes food, vendors and a “Cram the Cruiser” toy drive in the Honesdale National Bank parking lot […]
shorts.content: Carbondale Soup sale: Trinity Episcopal Church is holding a homemade soup sale until the end of winter or until soups run out. Quarts, $9; pints, $5. There is also chili and stew available in pints for $6. Those interested can stop by weekdays, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m., at the church, 58 River St. Information: 570-282-3620. Forest City Christmas at the Museum: 2025 Christmas at the Museum, Nov. 29, Main and Dundaff streets. Doors open 11 a.m. Choral and band concert, 1 p.m. Includes food, vendors and a “Cram the Cruiser” toy drive in the Honesdale National Bank parking lot […]
